instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not switch to headphone jack when plugged in
threads.message:
Hello

i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Original issue was no power, which i resolved by replacing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>. Then the left speaker wasn't working, replace <CHIP>U6400</CHIP> and left speak works now. Finally, when headphones are connected, no audio is sent to the headphones, the audio remains on the laptops speakers. I've replaced the headphone jack will cable assembly, no effect. Any suggestions as to where to start on this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not switch to headphone jack when plugged in
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>AUD_J1_SLEEVEDET_R</SIGNAL> level, when insert headphones.
You should note a change from speakers state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not switch to headphone jack when plugged in
threads.message: While testing for <SIGNAL>AUD_J1_SLEEVEDET_R</SIGNAL>, at first i wasn't getting any voltage but all of a sudden i started getting voltage readings. So, i resoldered all the pins of J6600 and have full audio on the headphone jack. Thanks for pointing me in the right direction. This is now fixed.
